Line 74: Line 74:
On 20th Feb 2008, German treasure hunters claimed to have found the Amber room.[http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20080226/ap_on_re_eu/germany_nazi_gold] The discovery of an estimated two tons of gold or silver was made at the weekend when electromagnetic pulse measurements located the man-made cavern 20 meters underground near the village of Deutschneudorf on Germany's border with the Czech Republic.[http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20080226/ap_on_re_eu/germany_nazi_gold]
On 20th Feb 2008, German treasure hunters claimed to have found the Amber room.[http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20080226/ap_on_re_eu/germany_nazi_gold] The discovery of an estimated two tons of gold or silver was made at the weekend when electromagnetic pulse measurements located the man-made cavern 20 meters underground near the village of Deutschneudorf on Germany's border with the Czech Republic.[http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20080226/ap_on_re_eu/germany_nazi_gold]
â
Opening the cavern to get into the chamber can not be completed until approximately Easter because it may contain [[booby traps]] and has to be secured by explosives experts and engineers.[citation needed]
+
Opening the cavern to get into the chamber can not be completed until approximately Easter because it may contain [[booby traps]] and has to be secured by explosives experts and engineers.[http://www.cnn.com/2008/TECH/science/02/26/nazi.gold/index.html?iref=newssearch]
According to a recent article by [[Der Spiegel]], Heinz-Peter Haustein - who has been leading the most recent searches into the "Ore Mountains" region of Germany - believes that he has found the Amber Room. Digging resumed [[February 26]] [[2008]] at a site in the southeastern German town of [[Deutschneudorf]], where [[treasure hunter]]s believe there are close to two tons of [[Nazi Germany|Nazi]] gold and possibly clues to the whereabouts of the legendary Amber Room.<ref>[[CNN]]: [http://edition.cnn.com/2008/TECH/science/02/25/nazi.gold/index.html Treasure hunters dig for Hitler's gold]</ref>
According to a recent article by [[Der Spiegel]], Heinz-Peter Haustein - who has been leading the most recent searches into the "Ore Mountains" region of Germany - believes that he has found the Amber Room. Digging resumed [[February 26]] [[2008]] at a site in the southeastern German town of [[Deutschneudorf]], where [[treasure hunter]]s believe there are close to two tons of [[Nazi Germany|Nazi]] gold and possibly clues to the whereabouts of the legendary Amber Room.<ref>[[CNN]]: [http://edition.cnn.com/2008/TECH/science/02/25/nazi.gold/index.html Treasure hunters dig for Hitler's gold]</ref>
